examples: His family comes first.
Knowledge of cooking comes easy to him.
Come rain or shine.
After dinner comes the reckoning.
All good things come to an end.
words.defineEn: to move or travel toward something or someone
words.defineVi: để di chuyển hoặc đi về phía một cái gì đó hoặc một ai đó

words.defineEn: to return to a person or place
words.defineVi: để trở lại một người hoặc địa điểm

examples: The ambassador was called back to London by the prime minister.
Within minutes, the president calls back.
I'm calling back.
Unlike the Model 3, the ID.3's display calls back to a traditional dashboard with touch-sensitive buttons with haptic feedback.
phone-- Hang up and call back.
words.defineEn: to return a phone call or contact someone again when the first attempt to communicate was missed or unsuccessful
words.defineVi: để trả lời một cuộc gọi điện thoại hoặc liên lạc lại với ai đó khi nỗ lực liên lạc đầu tiên bị bỏ lỡ hoặc không thành công

words.defineEn: to return to a previous location, position, or state
words.defineVi: để trở lại một vị trí, vị trí hoặc trạng thái trước đó

examples: And on Wall Street, stocks gave back some of Monday's big gains.
Way to give back.
Win and they’ll give back your uncle.
We don't always have to give back in terms of time and money, but we can also give back in terms of knowledge and skills.
That's a part of life and giving back.
words.defineEn: to return a thing to its previous owner
words.defineVi: để trả lại một điều cho chủ sở hữu trước đây của nó

examples: Mary keeps lending money to her unreliable friend, even though she never gets paid back.
However, due to a law change, it hasn't been paid back.
While it doesn't protect them from having to pay back rent, it qualifies them for federal rental assistance to take care of it.
He was given a week to pay back the loan.
$525 of her income taxes goes to pay back the debt the government borrows to say afloat.
words.defineEn: to return an amount of money to its pervious owner
words.defineVi: để trả lại một số tiền cho chủ sở hữu cũ của nó

examples: They'd get sent back with a flea in their ears just like the rest.
But 14 years later, the ESA’s Rosetta lander sent back images of the same feature on a comet.
It even sent back pictures of the surface.
Spain sent back at least 4,000 people.
They're being sent back right now under Title 42.
words.defineEn: to return something to its previous owner, particularly due to being damaged, unsatisfactory, or  unsuitable
words.defineVi: để trả lại một cái gì đó cho chủ sở hữu trước đây của nó, đặc biệt là do bị hư hỏng, không đạt yêu cầu, hoặc không phù hợp

examples: Oh, once I get my hands on you, you'll take back what you said!
Later, Ali Baba's wife takes back the scales.
Take back pain for instance.
We have taken back control of our laws and our destiny.
Together, we are taking back our country.
words.defineEn: to regain the possession of a thing or person
words.defineVi: để giành lại quyền sở hữu của một điều hoặc người
